message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses multiple datasets including the World Development Indicators and the Global Findex Database to examine the relationship between financial inclusion and poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Global Findex Database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis draws on data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture and the Demographic and Health Surveys in Ethiopia to examine the link between agricultural productivity and child nutrition.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a panel dataset of more than 130 countries from the World Bank Enterprise Survey and the World Economic Outlook to assess the impact of public-private partnerships on economic growth.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "World Economic Outlook"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Global Financial Inclusion Database and the World Bank Enterprise Survey, we investigate the effect of financial sector development on firm performance in developing economies.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion Database", "World Bank Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This paper utilizes cross-sectional survey data from the Afrobarometer and the World Values Survey to investigate the determinants of democratic governance in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Afrobarometer", "World Values Survey"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We combine information on disasters compiled by the European Commission's Joint Research Centre with household survey data collected by the Demographic and Health Surveys Program to analyze the impact of natural disasters on maternal and child health in Asia.", "dataset": ["European Commission's Joint Research Centre", "Demographic and Health Surveys Program"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we use data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and Doing Business reports to examine whether access to finance can mitigate barriers to entrepreneurship in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Doing Business reports"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on a matched employer-employee dataset from the Colombia National Statistical Office and the Colombian Social Protection Survey, which allows us to explore the relationship between labor informality and social protection coverage.", "dataset": ["Colombia National Statistical Office", "Colombian Social Protection Survey"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using cross-country data from the United Nations Comtrade database and the World Bank's Logistics Performance Index, we investigate the determinants of trade costs and how they vary across countries.", "dataset": ["United Nations Comtrade database", "World Bank's Logistics Performance Index"], "topic": ["Trade", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "Our empirical analysis draws on a rich panel dataset that combines firm-level information from the World Bank Enterprise Survey with trade exposure measures from input-output tables to assess the impact of regional trade agreements on firm performance.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "input-output tables"], "topic": ["Regional Integration", "Competitiveness"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This study uses multiple datasets including the World Development Indicators and the Global Findex Database to examine the relationship between financial inclusion and poverty
